A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
SPOILERS

Luke Skywalker is reduced to a quivering imbecile who attempts child murder of his sleeping nephew to point of brandishing a lethal weapon above the child's head but is too much of an indecisive goon to even get killing a sleeping child right.  If this sounds like the nexus of a good Star Wars movie to you then you may indeed enjoy The Last Jedi. 

The movie also some how makes a spaceship chase boring as apparently now all Star Wars ships can only 
move at a maximum speed of yawn.....until they run out of gas. 

All the characters seem to work really hard at making you not care about  what happens to them next. So there is no point mentioning them. 

Plot holes? Sure. Inconsistencies? Sure. But who cares. This movie hates itself to the point of not even caring what it looks like when it goes out in public. 

Some sort of space cat giraffes were saved and that made the whole thing worth while.
